_header: Lo here this lady that ye may see
Subjects: pageant verses; allegories; Fortune; virtues, principal
_description: A Mumming at London, by Lydgate — 342 lines in couplets

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Loo here þis lady þat yee may seeLady of
                    mutabilitee…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…Suche oon as þou lykeþe bestLat ffortune go pley
                    hir wher hir list
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
Lo here filoweþe þe deuyse of a desguysing to fore þe gret
                    estates of þis lande þane being at London madeby Lidegate daun Johan
                    þe Munk of Buryof dame fortune dame proudence dame Rightwysnesse and dame
                    ffortitudo beholdeþe for it is moral plesaunt and notable. Loo first
                    komeþe in dame ffortune (p. 55); A desguysing made by Lydgate of þe
                    foure Cardynale vertues (RT)
CamTCC600.Editions:
Brotanek,  Rudolph. 
             Die Englischen Maskenspiele.
         Vienna, Leipzig: W. Braumüller, 1902: 309-17.
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 682-91.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
Loo here this lady that ye may seelady of
                    mutabilyte…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…suche on as you lyketh bestlat ffortune go playe hir wher hir
                    liste
BLAdd29729.Attributed Author: lidgate dan Iohn the munke of bury (f. 140)
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
Lo here folowethe the deuyse of a desguysinge to fore the grete estates of
                    this lond than beinge at london made by lidgate dan Iohn the munke of bury of
                    dame fortune dame prudence dame rightwysnesse and dame ffortitude behold it for
                    it is morall plesaunt and notabell to first cometh in dame fortune (f.
                    140)
